metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20212 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in Privoxy in versions before 3.0.29. Memory leak if multiple filters are executed and the last one is skipped due to a pcre error leading to a system crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

privoxy - 3.0.21-7+deb8u1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: privoxy package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.21-7+deb8u1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
